com.mappedin.sdk

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • com.mappedin.sdk.MapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class MapView
extends android.app.Fragment
implements android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer
    MapView is a custom view designed to handle displaying Maps for a Venue. call setMap(Map, MappedinCallback) to display the first map.

      • setMap

        public void setMap(@NonNull
                   Map map)

        Sets the MapView to display specific map associated with the current venue.

        This will also draw any Element objects (like part of a Path) that fall onto the new map.

        Parameters:
        map - The map to display. Typically this would be another floor.
        code snip:
         mapView.setMap(polygon.getMap());

      • setMap

        public void setMap(@NonNull
                   Map map,
                   MappedinCallback<Map> callback)

        Sets the MapView to display specific map associated with the current venue. trigger the MappedinCallback.onComplete when map loading is finished

        This will also draw any Element objects (like part of a Path) that fall onto the new map.

        Parameters:
        map - The map to display. Typically this would be another floor.
        callback - MappedinCallback call back function when mapView finish loading map. onComplete function should use runOnUiThread (only the least callback will be called)
        code snip:
         MappedinCallback setMapCallback = new MappedinCallback() {
      @Override
     public void onCompleted(Map map) {
         runOnUiThread(new Runnable() {
              @Override
             public void run() {
                 hideLoadingLogo()
             }
         });
     }
      @Override
     public void onError(Exception exception) {

     }
 };
 mapView.setMap(polygon.getMap(), setMapCallback);

        public void setDelegate(MapViewDelegate delegate)

        Parameters:

      • getCameraHeading

        public float getCameraHeading()
        Returns the current direction the MapView is pointing at, in radians, relative to North.

      • orbit

        public void orbit(Focusable orbiting,
                  float heading,
                  float tilt,
                  float over)
        Move the camera to fit a focusable object into screen with, rotating to the requested heading and tilt, over a period of time
        Parameters:
        orbiting - A Focusable object (such as Polygon or Map) to fit into screen
        heading - Camera heading value
        tilt - Camera tilt value
        over - Period of time to animate the camera movement, in seconds.
        code snip:
         
 Cylinder cylinder = new Cylinder(1.7f, 3.2f, Color.GRAY);
 mapView.orbit(cylinder, 0f, (float) Math.PI / 5, 1f);

      • orbit

        public void orbit(Focusable[] orbiting,
                  float heading,
                  float tilt,
                  float over)
        move camera to fit all focusable objects into screen with request heading and tilt in period of time
        Parameters:
        orbiting - Focusable objects (could be Coordinate, Polygon and/or Map) to fit into screen
        heading - camera heading value
        tilt - camera tilt value
        over - period of time
        code snip:
         
 Cylinder cylinder = new Cylinder(1.7f, 3.2f, Color.GRAY);
 android.location.Location geoLocation = new android.location.Location("mappedin example");
 geoLocation.setLatitude(43.825103);
 geoLocation.setLongitude(-79.539562);
 Coordinate coordinate = new Coordinate(geoLocation,venue.getMaps()[0]);
 mapView.orbit(new Focusable[]{cylinder, coordinate}, 0f, (float) Math.PI / 5, 1f);

      • frame

        public void frame(@NonNull
                  Focusable framing,
                  float heading,
                  float tilt,
                  float over)
        move camera to fit focusable object into screen with request heading and tilt in period of time
        Parameters:
        framing - Focusable object (either Polygon or Map ) tobe fit into screen
        heading - camera heading value
        tilt - camera tilt value
        over - period of time
        code snip:
         
 Cylinder cylinder = new Cylinder(1.7f, 3.2f, Color.GRAY);
 mapView.frame(cylinder, 0f, (float) Math.PI / 5, 1f);

      • frame

        public void frame(@NonNull
                  Focusable[] framing,
                  float heading,
                  float tilt,
                  float over)
        move camera to fit all focusable objects into screen with request heading and tilt in period of time
        Parameters:
        framing - Focusable objects
        heading - camera heading value
        tilt - camera tilt value
        over - period of time
        code snip:
         
 Cylinder cylinder = new Cylinder(1.7f, 3.2f, Color.GRAY);
 android.location.Location geoLocation = new android.location.Location("mappedin example");
 geoLocation.setLatitude(43.825103);
 geoLocation.setLongitude(-79.539562);
 Coordinate coordinate = new Coordinate(geoLocation,venue.getMaps()[0]);
 mapView.frame(new Focusable[]{cylinder, coordinate}, 0f, (float) Math.PI / 5, 1f);

      • setColor

        public void setColor(@NonNull
                     Polygon polygon,
                     int color,
                     float over)
        Changes the polygon color, animated over some time. Use this to highlight polygons.
        Parameters:
        polygon - Polygon
        color - Color
        over - the animation time in seconds

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(@NonNull
                      Polygon polygon,
                      float height,
                      float over)
        Changes the polygon height over time. Can be useful as part of setColor to highlight a polygon.
        Parameters:
        polygon - Polygon
        height - the rising distance in meters
        over - the animation time in seconds

      • resetPolygon

        public void resetPolygon(@NonNull
                         Polygon polygon)
        Sets the (hightlight)polygon back to it's original color and height does nothing if not highlight polygon
        Parameters:
        polygon - Polygon

      • addAllStoreLabels

        public void addAllStoreLabels(Venue venue,
                              android.text.TextPaint textPaint)
        Adds store labels to all of the Polygons in this Venue. The content will be the name of the location attached to that Polygon, if any.
        Parameters:
        venue - The target venue
        textPaint - TextPaint set label's size, color and font here (if the content is too big to fit in the polygon it will try shrink it text size to 75%, 50% and 25%)
        code snip:
         
 TextPaint textPaint = new TextPaint();
 textPaint.setColor(Color.BLACK);
 textPaint.setTextSize(20);
 textPaint.setTypeface(Typeface.SANS_SERIF);
 mapView.addAllStoreLabels(venue, textPaint);

      • removeAllStoreLabels

        public void removeAllStoreLabels(Venue venue)
        Removes all store labels from all maps in the venue
        Parameters:
        venue - The target venue
